column4: I cant get a correct listing of .gvfs even with root, who should own the .gvfs folder? And what permissions?
Which .gvfs folder?  The one in ~?
yes, that one, I have ? for owner and permissions even when listing as root
I think it should be you...
Let me check
Yeah, mine's owned by me
great, thanks!
chown: cannot access `.gvfs': Permission denied, and that is with root :/
O.o
Some sort of corruption, I suppose.
How did this even happen?
yeah, guess so
I'm no expert on disk recovery, but see what you can run for disk checks.
trying reboot and forcefsck
If it's just a messed up permission issue, something basic should catch it.
There was a specific option with fsck that would be liable to fix that, and I'm blanking out on what it was
I also have a lot of files in home created  "0 Jul" ??
Sounds like it could be a bad disk, then.  Check the SMART status.
ghostchick I did a forcefsck and everything is back to normal with my .gvfs folder :)
Yay!  Now double-check the SMART status to make sure your hard drive isn't about to die on you.
it's fine, already checked, everything is green
Awesome.  Might've just been a power outage or something.
I had the laptop running this night to complete a backup, might have something to do with that
